column2: Q12. STARTING JANUARY 1ST, 2014 MOST AMERICANS ABOVE A CERTAIN INCOME LEVEL WILL BE REQUIRED BY THE AFFORDABLE CARE ACT TO PURCHASE HEALTH INSURANCE OR PAY A FINE. THE  GOVERNMENT WOULD PROVIDE SUBSIDIES FOR INDIVIDUALS EARNING LESS THAN $46,000 A YEAR OR A FAMILY OF FOUR EARNING LESS THAN $94,200. DO YOU SUPPORT OR OPPOSE THIS REQUIREMENT?

column3: NUMBER OF ANSWERS IN THIS TABLE

column2: Q15. PART OF THIS LAW WOULD EXPAND MEDICAID, THE GOVERNMENT HEALTH PROGRAM FOR THE POOR, TO PROVIDE COVERAGE TO MANY LOW-INCOME ADULTS CURRENTLY WITHOUT COVERAGE, SUCH AS  SINGLE ADULTS EARNING BELOW $16,000 A YEAR. THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT WOULD INITIALLY COVER 100 PERCENT OF THE ENTIRE COST OF THIS EXPANSION FOR THE FIRST FEW YEARS. AFTER  THAT, THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT WOULD PAY 90%, WITH THE STATES PAYING 10 PERCENT. STATES HAVE THE RIGHT TO REFUSE THE EXPANSION, AND GEORGIA HAS DECIDED AGAINST IT, CITING  THE COST. DO YOU THINK THAT GEORGIA SHOULD ALLOW THE EXPANSION OF MEDICAID TO COVER LOW INCOME UNINSURED ADULTS, OR SHOULD IT REFUSE TO PARTICIPATE?

column3: NO, GEORGIA SHOULD REFUSE TO PARTICIPATE
NUMBER OF ANSWERS IN THIS TABLE
